text: Women think with their whole bodies and they see things as a whole more than men do.
author: Dorothy Day

text: If I err in belief that the souls of men are immortal, I gladly err, nor do I wish this error which gives me pleasure to be wrested from me while I live.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

text: Men are born with two eyes, but with one tongue, in order that they should see twice as much as they say.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

text: Forgive, son men are men they needs must err.
author: Euripides

text: No lying knight or lying priest ever prospered in any age, but especially not in the dark ones. Men prospered then only in following an openly declared purpose, and preaching candidly beloved and trusted creeds.
author: John Ruskin
